snippet: Chancellor Carmen Fariña is expected to announce that principals will report to district superintendents, dispensing with a core philosophy of the Bloomberg administration.
abstract: New York City Schools Chancellor Carmen Farina will unveil changes aimed at restoring centralized hierarchy to city's schools, including requiring principals to report to district superintendents, in effort to dispense with philosophy established by Bloomberg administration; Farina has criticized former system, which granted increased freedom to individual principals, as leaving schools struggling with too little supervision.
lead_paragraph: Chancellor Carmen Fariña is expected to announce that principals will report to district superintendents, dispensing with a core philosophy of the Bloomberg administration.

headline.main: Chancellor Set to Centralize Management of New York City Schools
headline.print_headline: Chancellor Set to Centralize Management of Schools
